skill.name: qa-test-planner
skill.description: Generate comprehensive test plans, manual test cases, regression test suites, and bug reports for QA engineers. Includes Figma MCP integration for design validation.
skill.summary: Generate comprehensive test plans, manual test cases, regression test suites, and bug reports for QA engineers
skill.author: softaworks

security_audit.summary: Static analysis detected 295 patterns (131 external_commands, 163 weak_crypto) in documentation and code. All high-severity findings are FALSE POSITIVES - the 'weak cryptographic algorithm' patterns are security-related test case examples (e.g., SQL injection testing), and 'backtick execution' patterns are markdown code fences. The shell scripts use safe interactive prompts for generating test documentation without executing arbitrary commands. No malicious behavior or intent detected.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm Detection
high_findings.description: Static analyzer flagged 'weak cryptographic algorithm' patterns in markdown documentation. These are FALSE POSITIVES - the detected text refers to security test cases (e.g., SQL injection testing at SKILL.md:701), security testing documentation, and cryptographic references in bug severity type definitions. No actual cryptographic code or weak algorithms exist in this skill.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: The flagged lines contain text like 'SQL injection attempt' in test case examples and 'Security' as a test type. These are legitimate documentation of security testing scenarios, not actual cryptographic algorithm implementations.

medium_findings.title: False Positive: Shell Backtick Execution Detection
medium_findings.description: Static analyzer detected 'Ruby/shell backtick execution' patterns. These are FALSE POSITIVES - the detected backticks are markdown code fences (```) and inline code formatting (`) used throughout documentation for displaying example test cases, scripts, and templates. No actual backtick command execution occurs.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: Backticks in markdown files are syntax for code fences and inline code, not shell command execution. The skill generates documentation and markdown files, it does not execute arbitrary shell commands with user input.

low_findings.title: Safe Use of eval for Variable Assignment
low_findings.description: Script uses eval for dynamic variable assignment from user input (line 33 in generate_test_cases.sh). While eval can be dangerous, in this context it is used for creating shell variables (TC_ID, TC_TITLE, etc.) with hardcoded names, not for command execution. The output is safely written to markdown files with no system command calls.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: The eval is used for variable assignment (var_name is hardcoded like 'TC_ID'), not command execution. No shell commands are executed with user input. Output is written safely to files.

content.user_title: Create QA Test Plans and Test Cases
content.value_statement: QA teams spend hours creating test plans and manual test cases from scratch. This skill generates comprehensive test plans, test cases, regression suites, and bug reports automatically using proven QA methodologies and templates.
actual_capabilities: Generate comprehensive test plans with scope, strategy, risks, and timeline
Create detailed manual test cases with steps, preconditions, and expected results
Build regression test suites organized by priority and execution order
Validate implementations against Figma designs using MCP integration
Produce structured bug reports with reproduction steps and evidence
limitations: Does not execute tests automatically - generates documentation only
Figma validation requires Figma MCP server to be configured
Test data must be provided by the user - no automatic test data generation
Cannot access live application environments or execute test automation

use_cases.title: New Feature Testing
use_cases.description: Generate a complete test plan and set of test cases for a new feature before development begins, ensuring testable requirements are documented early.

use_cases.title: UI Design Validation
use_cases.description: Compare implemented designs against Figma specifications, validating colors, spacing, typography, and component states before release.

use_cases.title: Release Regression Testing
use_cases.description: Build a regression test suite that prioritizes critical business paths, enabling efficient release validation with smoke tests and targeted regression.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Test Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a test plan for the {feature_name} feature. Include test scope, objectives, testing approach, environment requirements, entry/exit criteria, and risk assessment.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need a complete test plan document for a new feature

prompt_templates.title: Generate Test Cases
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate {number} manual test cases for the {feature_name} feature. Include functional test cases covering positive and negative scenarios, edge cases, and boundary value testing.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need detailed test cases with steps and expected results

prompt_templates.title: Regression Suite
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a regression test suite for the {module_name} module. Include smoke tests, critical path tests, and execution order. Prioritize tests by business impact.
prompt_templates.scenario: When preparing for a release and need to verify existing functionality

prompt_templates.title: Bug Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a bug report for the following issue: {bug_description}. Include reproducible steps, environment details, severity, priority, and expected vs actual behavior.
prompt_templates.scenario: When documenting a discovered bug with clear reproduction information

output_examples.input: Create a test plan for user authentication feature
output: Scope: Login, logout, password reset, session management
Environment: Staging with test user accounts

output_examples.input: Generate 5 test cases for checkout flow
output: TC-CHECKOUT-001: Successful checkout with valid items
TC-CHECKOUT-002: Checkout with invalid coupon code

best_practices: Always define clear preconditions and test data requirements before writing test steps
Include both positive and negative test cases to validate error handling
Link test cases to requirements for traceability and coverage tracking
anti_patterns: Writing vague test steps without specific expected results
Skipping edge cases and boundary value testing

faq.question: Does this skill execute tests automatically?
faq.answer: No, this skill generates test documentation (plans, cases, reports). Test execution requires manual QA work or automated test runners.

faq.question: How do I use Figma validation?
faq.answer: Configure a Figma MCP server, then use prompts like 'Compare the login page against Figma at [URL]' to generate visual validation test cases.

faq.question: Can I customize the templates?
faq.answer: Yes, reference templates in the references/ folder can be modified. The skill uses these as starting points for generation.

faq.question: What test types are supported?
faq.answer: Functional, UI/Visual, Integration, Regression, Performance, and Security testing templates are included.

faq.question: How are priorities assigned?
faq.answer: P0 (Critical) blocks release, P1 (High) affects major features, P2 (Medium) is nice to have, P3 (Low) is minor.

faq.question: Can I generate multiple test cases at once?
faq.answer: Yes, specify the number in your prompt like 'Generate 20 test cases for the search feature' for bulk creation.
